shorts.title: New Milford Area Rotary collaborates with bank
shorts.title_distilled: New Milford Area Rotary collaborates with bank.
shorts.description: The New Milford Area Rotary recently celebrated a successful application for a grant from the Peoples Security Bank and Trust (PSB+T) Foundation on behalf of Northeast Pennsylvania Community Health Care. In March, the $1,000 grant was presented to NEPA Community Health Care at its facility in Montrose. The grant will be combined with a Rotary District 7410 District Designated Fund (DDF) grant of $2,500 and a New Milford Area Rotary Club grant of $1,000. The $4,500 total is to purchase refrigerator/freezer vaccine storage units that include emergency power backup features. Units will be installed at all four of the NEPA […]
shorts.content: The New Milford Area Rotary recently celebrated a successful application for a grant from the Peoples Security Bank and Trust (PSB+T) Foundation on behalf of Northeast Pennsylvania Community Health Care. The $4,500 total is to purchase refrigerator/freezer vaccine storage units that include emergency power backup features. Units will be installed at all four of the NEPA […]

shorts.title: Preserving the past while looking forward in Archbald
shorts.title_distilled: Preserving the past while looking forward in Archbald.
shorts.description: Along with the planned restoration of three Gravity Slope Colliery buildings near the Lackawanna River Heritage Trail’s Laurel Street Trailhead, the wheels are in motion to bring an adaptive bike shed to the same spot in Archbald. Borough Manager Dan Markey noted crews from Stafursky Paving Co. Inc. began working around the former oil storage building around May, and Valley in Motion received a grant to make the trail more accessible for more people. “We’re planning on grading the parking lot and then grading out a spot where they can place the shed,” Markey said. The $74,000 Department of Conservation […]
shorts.content: Along with the planned restoration of three Gravity Slope Colliery buildings near the Lackawanna River Heritage Trail’s Laurel Street Trailhead, the wheels are in motion to bring an adaptive bike shed to the same spot in Archbald. Borough Manager Dan Markey noted crews from Stafursky Paving Co. Inc. began working around the former oil storage building around May, and Valley in Motion received a grant to make the trail more accessible for more people. “We’re planning on grading the parking lot and then grading out a spot where they can place the shed,” Markey said. The $74,000 Department of Conservation […]
shorts.content_distilled: Along with the planned restoration of three Gravity Slope Colliery buildings near the Lackawanna River Heritage Trail’s Laurel Street Trailhead, the wheels are in motion to bring an adaptive bike shed to the same spot in Archbald.

shorts.title: NeighborWorks announces record number of Beautiful Blocks grants
shorts.title_distilled: NeighborWorks announces record number of Beautiful Blocks grants.
shorts.description: The nonprofit NeighborWorks Northeastern Pennsylvania recently announced a record number of grants this year through the “Beautiful Blocks” home improvement program, with grant funding supporting projects at 157 properties in Scranton, 73 in Carbondale and 58 in Pittston. Administered by NeighborWorks with support from various partners, Beautiful Blocks provides matching grants of up to $1,000 per property to groups of five or more residents in participating communities to help fund exterior improvements to their homes. Property owners undertaking significant front sidewalk projects were eligible for up to $2,000 in funding this year. The 2025 cycle marks the program’s second year […]
shorts.content: The nonprofit NeighborWorks Northeastern Pennsylvania recently announced a record number of grants this year through the “Beautiful Blocks” home improvement program, with grant funding supporting projects at 157 properties in Scranton, 73 in Carbondale and 58 in Pittston. Administered by NeighborWorks with support from various partners, Beautiful Blocks provides matching grants of up to $1,000 per property to groups of five or more residents in participating communities to help fund exterior improvements to their homes. Property owners undertaking significant front sidewalk projects were eligible for up to $2,000 in funding this year. The 2025 cycle marks the program’s second year […]

shorts.title: United Neighborhood Centers awarded grant from SAF
shorts.title_distilled: United Neighborhood Centers awarded grant from SAF.
shorts.description: United Neighborhood Centers of Northeastern Pennsylvania received a $12,000 Fall 2024 Community Needs grant from the Scranton Area Community Foundation to support the agency’s Emergency Services, which assists over 12,000 clients and their families each year with immediate help for basic needs, including food, rent, utility assistance, clothing, gasoline, prescription vouchers and housing support. UNC helps families stabilize their finances and work toward long-term self-sufficiency through its Angel’s Attic Food and Clothing pantry and case management services. UNC’s Emergency Assistance Program has been a vital resource for vulnerable populations in the community for decades, providing essential support to individuals and […]
shorts.content: United Neighborhood Centers of Northeastern Pennsylvania received a $12,000 Fall 2024 Community Needs grant from the Scranton Area Community Foundation to support the agency’s Emergency Services, which assists over 12,000 clients and their families each year with immediate help for basic needs, including food, rent, utility assistance, clothing, gasoline, prescription vouchers and housing support. UNC helps families stabilize their finances and work toward long-term self-sufficiency through its Angel’s Attic Food and Clothing pantry and case management services.
